title: He Heeded Russia’s Call to Enlist. Five Months Later, He Was Dead.
description: Pvt. Ivan Ovlashenko was one of at least 16,000 Russians who have died in Ukraine, more than in the Soviets’ Afghan war. It’s getting hard for the Kremlin to cover that up.

title: He Heeded Russia’s Call to Enlist. Five Months Later, He Was Dead.
description: Pvt. Ivan Ovlashenko was one of at least 16,000 Russians who have died in Ukraine, more than in the Soviets’ Afghan war. It’s getting hard for the Kremlin to cover that up.

title: Your Tuesday Briefing: South Korea’s Olive Branch to Japan
description: Also, Ukraine says it wants to strengthen its presence in Bakhmut.

title: Protests Over Netanyahu’s Judiciary Overhaul Spread to Israel’s Military
description: The military leadership is concerned that anger over the government’s plan, with some pilots saying they will skip some training sessions and operations, could diminish military capabilities.

title: Plunge in Currency Deepens Iran’s Economic Crisis
description: Years of Western sanctions are partly to blame for the crisis. But economists say poor management by the country’s authoritarian clerical rulers also plays a big part.

title: A Rival for Erdogan Emerges as Opposition Parties Pick a Candidate
description: Kemal Kilicdaroglu, the head of Turkey’s largest opposition party, and his allies are looking to unseat President Recep Tayyip Erdogan, who they say has damaged the country’s democracy.

title: U.S. to Challenge Mexican Ban on Genetically Modified Corn
description: The Biden administration said it would request talks with Mexico over a brewing trade fight.

title: Ukraine’s helicopter brigades defy odds to remain operational.
Belarus Sentences Exiled Opposition Leader to 15 Years in Prison
description: Sviatlana Tsikhanouskaya fled the country after running for president in 2020 against Belarus’s authoritarian leader. She has described the conspiracy case against her as a “farce.”

title: How the Czech Republic Qualified for the World Baseball Classic
description: The World Baseball Classic is a battle of the game’s biggest stars. A scrappy Czech Republic team, full of guys with regular jobs, just might win your heart.

title: Food security, energy and military aid: What to watch for this week.
Asian Americans, Shifting Right
description: The new politics of class in America.

title: Ukraine Claims Strike Hit Russian Region Used to Launch Attacks
description: In a rare public acknowledgment of a cross-border strike, Ukrainian special forces said one of their drones had destroyed an unmanned watch tower in Russia’s Bryansk region. Here’s what we’re covering:

title: Dalit Journalist Takes On India’s Caste Injustices
description: Meena Kotwal started a news outlet focused on Dalit and other marginalized groups in India, hoping that telling their stories will help improve their lives.

title: Maryse Condé, at Home in the World
description: Throughout her four-decade literary career, the Guadeloupean writer has explored a global vision of the Black diaspora, and placed Caribbean life at the center.

title: Estonia Election Delivers Vote of Confidence for Ukraine Aid
description: The party of Prime Minister Kaja Kallas, who has pushed the West to send more weapons to Kyiv and impose tougher penalties on Moscow, took about double the tally of the second-place finisher.

title: The West is scrambling to find Soviet-era weapons for Ukraine.
Ukrainian Soldiers, Nearly Encircled, Push Russians Back
description: The battle for Bakhmut is not over — at least not yet. Ukrainian assault brigades offered Moscow a bloody reminder of that over the weekend.

title: Your Monday Briefing
description: The fight for the Ukrainian city of Bakhmut.

title: South Korea Offers a Resolution to Wartime Labor Dispute With Japan
description: Seoul said it would create a fund to compensate Koreans who were forced into labor by Japanese companies during World War II, an issue Tokyo says was settled long ago.
